docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona’s rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

headline.main: Arizona: Court Continues to Block Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Court Continues to Block Abortion Rules

docs.abstract: Federal appeals court rules that Arizona's rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out.
docs.snippet: Arizona’s rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A compulsion to repeat emerged as a common theme as colleagues of the choreographer DD Dorvillier presented solos at Danspace last weekend.

headline.seo: Solos by DD Dorvillier’s Colleagues at St. Mark’s Church
headline.main: Childbirth, a Lit Torch and a Trot
headline.print_headline: Childbirth, a Lit Torch and a Trot

docs.abstract: Brian Seibert reviews second weekend of performances in series Diary of an Image by DD Dorvillier at Danspace Project, in which Dorvillier invites other choreographers to perform solos of their own.
docs.snippet: A compulsion to repeat emerged as a common theme as colleagues of the choreographer DD Dorvillier presented solos at Danspace last weekend.

headline.main: Telling Congress What Families Need, One City, State or Hearing at a Time

docs.abstract: At a Senate committee hearing, a supporter of paid family leave tries to convince legislators on both sides of the aisle that there’s broad bipartisan support for policies that support families.
docs.snippet: At a Senate committee hearing, a supporter of paid family leave tries to convince legislators on both sides of the aisle that there’s broad bipartisan support for policies that support families.

docs.lead_paragraph: Enforcement of Arizona regulations curbing access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses of the medication will remain on hold while a legal challenge to those rules proceeds under judicial review, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

headline.main: Arizona Abortion Drug Restrictions to Stay Blocked Pending Appeal
headline.print_headline: Arizona Abortion Drug Restrictions to Stay Blocked Pending Appeal

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's strictest rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The majority of the world's poorer countries, which account for nearly all childbirth-related deaths among newborns and mothers, are facing a critical shortage of professional midwives who could ease the problem, global health experts said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Poorer Countries Lack Midwives to Cut Birth Deaths: Report

headline.main: Sperm Donation is Full of Euphemisms, and an 11-Year-Old is Full of Questions

docs.abstract: When I announced the pregnancy at a family dinner, my father reminded my younger brother that I was “helping out” friends by being their “donor.” “But David’s gay,” he helpfully reminded the table. “How can they make a baby if they’re not having sex?”

docs.abstract: A growing cadre of families who are raising their children on entirely uncooked fare, but many doctors caution against the trend.

docs.lead_paragraph: A unanimous Supreme Court ruled Monday that prosecutors may not rely on an international chemical weapons treaty to convict a woman who attacked her husband's mistress.

headline.main: Justices: Treaty Can't Be Invoked in Assault Case

docs.lead_paragraph: “Do Fathers Matter?” cites research that shows that fathers have an outsize effect on their children’s vocabulary, and that their presence can delay daughters’ puberty, among other findings.

headline.seo: ‘Do Fathers Matter?’ Shows Why They Do
headline.main: Relevant? Nurturing? Well, So’s Your Old Man
headline.print_headline: Relevant? Nurturing? Well, So’s Your Old Man

docs.abstract: Mark Oppenheimer reviews book Do Fathers Matter? What Science Is Telling Us About the Parent We've Overlooked by Paul Raeburn.
docs.snippet: “Do Fathers Matter?” cites research that shows that fathers have an outsize effect on their children’s vocabulary, and that their presence can delay daughters’ puberty, among other findings.
